tasks.title: Setup Electron + TypeScript Project Foundation
tasks.description: Initialize a new Electron project with TypeScript configuration, including proper build tooling and development environment setup
tasks.details: Use Electron 28.x with TypeScript 5.3+. Setup electron-forge for build management. Configure webpack 5 for optimal bundling. Structure: src/main (main process), src/renderer (React app), src/shared (shared types). Install core dependencies: electron@28.1.0, typescript@5.3.3, @electron-forge/cli@7.2.0. Configure tsconfig.json with strict mode, ES2022 target. Setup nodemon for main process hot reload. Configure CSP headers for security.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify electron app launches, TypeScript compiles without errors, hot reload works for both main/renderer processes. Test production build generation.

subtasks.title: Initialize the Project
subtasks.description: Create a new project directory and initialize it with npm to generate a package.json file.
subtasks.details: Run 'npm init' in your project directory to set up the initial package.json. This step lays the foundation for dependency management and project configuration.[1][2]

subtasks.title: Configure TypeScript
subtasks.description: Install TypeScript and set up the TypeScript configuration file (tsconfig.json) with appropriate compiler options.
subtasks.details: Install TypeScript as a dev dependency. Generate tsconfig.json using 'tsc --init' and configure options such as 'outDir', 'target', 'module', 'strict', and 'esModuleInterop'.[1][4]

subtasks.title: Set Up Electron Forge
subtasks.description: Install Electron Forge and configure it to work with TypeScript.
subtasks.details: Install Electron Forge and its CLI. Configure Electron Forge to use TypeScript by installing 'ts-node' and creating a 'forge.config.ts' file for project configuration.[5]

subtasks.title: Configure Webpack
subtasks.description: Install and configure Webpack for bundling TypeScript and Electron code.
subtasks.details: Install Webpack and necessary loaders/plugins for TypeScript. Set up Webpack configuration files to handle both main and renderer processes, ensuring compatibility with Electron and TypeScript.

subtasks.title: Structure Source Directories
subtasks.description: Organize the project directory structure for Electron's main and renderer processes.
subtasks.details: Create directories such as 'src/main' and 'src/renderer' for clear separation of Electron's main and renderer code. Add entry files like 'main.ts' and 'index.html'.[2]

subtasks.title: Install and Configure Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install Electron, TypeScript types, and any additional dependencies required for development.
subtasks.details: Install Electron, @types/electron, and any other libraries needed for your app. Update package.json scripts for building and running the app.[1][4]

subtasks.title: Set Up Development Tools and CSP Headers
subtasks.description: Configure development tools like nodemon for hot reloading and set up Content Security Policy (CSP) headers.
subtasks.details: Install nodemon or similar tools for automatic reloads during development. Configure CSP headers in your Electron app to enhance security.

tasks.title: Implement SQLite Database Layer
tasks.description: Setup SQLite database with TypeORM for managing EVE SDE data and user configurations
tasks.details: Install better-sqlite3@9.3.0 and typeorm@0.3.19. Create database service in main process with entities for Ships, Modules, Skills, MarketGroups. Implement migrations system. Design schema: ships table (typeID, typeName, groupID, attributes JSON), modules table (typeID, typeName, effects JSON, requirements JSON), skills table. Create DatabaseService class with connection pooling. Implement data access layer with repositories pattern. Add indexes on frequently queried columns (typeID, groupID).
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test all database operations, verify connection handling, test migration execution, benchmark query performance with large datasets

subtasks.title: Install Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install all required database and ORM dependencies for the project.
subtasks.details: Install packages such as database drivers, ORM libraries (e.g., Entity Framework Core, Hibernate), and any supporting tools.

subtasks.title: Create Entity Classes
subtasks.description: Implement entity classes that map to the database schema.
subtasks.details: Write classes in the application codebase that represent database tables and relationships.

subtasks.title: Set Up Migrations
subtasks.description: Configure and initialize database migrations.
subtasks.details: Set up migration tools (e.g., EF Core Migrations) to manage schema changes and versioning[5].

subtasks.title: Implement DatabaseService
subtasks.description: Create a service layer for database operations.
subtasks.details: Implement a service class to encapsulate CRUD operations and business logic.

subtasks.title: Configure Connection Pooling
subtasks.description: Optimize database connections with connection pooling.
subtasks.details: Configure connection pooling settings in the application to improve performance and resource usage.

subtasks.title: Build Data Access Layer
subtasks.description: Implement the data access layer for robust data retrieval and manipulation.
subtasks.details: Write repository or DAO classes to abstract data access logic from business logic[3][4].

subtasks.title: Add Indexes and Write Unit Tests
subtasks.description: Optimize queries with indexes and ensure reliability with unit tests.
subtasks.details: Add appropriate database indexes for performance and write unit tests for data access and service layers.

tasks.title: Create EVE SDE Data Import System
tasks.description: Build system to download, parse, and import EVE Online Static Data Export into local SQLite database
tasks.details: Create SDE downloader using axios@1.6.5 to fetch from https://eve-static-data-export.s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/. Parse YAML files using js-yaml@4.1.0. Implement incremental import with progress tracking. Create data transformers for typeIDs.yaml, invTypes.yaml, dgmTypeAttributes.yaml, dgmTypeEffects.yaml. Implement checksum verification. Add data validation layer. Create background import process with IPC communication to renderer for progress updates. Cache parsed data with version tracking.
tasks.testStrategy: Test import of full SDE dataset, verify data integrity, test incremental updates, measure import performance, validate all ship/module relationships

subtasks.title: Implement Downloader
subtasks.description: Develop a module to download SDE data files from remote sources, supporting retries and error handling.
subtasks.details: This component should handle network operations, manage download progress, and ensure files are saved to the correct location.

subtasks.title: Parse YAML Files
subtasks.description: Create a parser to read and interpret YAML files from the downloaded SDE data.
subtasks.details: The parser should efficiently handle large YAML files and convert them into in-memory data structures for further processing.

subtasks.title: Handle Incremental Imports
subtasks.description: Design a mechanism to detect and process only new or changed data during subsequent imports.
subtasks.details: This should minimize processing time and resource usage by avoiding redundant imports.

subtasks.title: Add Progress Tracking
subtasks.description: Integrate progress tracking throughout the import process to provide real-time feedback.
subtasks.details: Progress indicators should cover downloading, parsing, transforming, and importing steps.

subtasks.title: Implement Checksum Verification
subtasks.description: Add checksum verification to ensure the integrity of downloaded and parsed data files.
subtasks.details: Checksums should be validated before processing files to prevent corrupted data from entering the system.

subtasks.title: Validate Data
subtasks.description: Develop validation routines to check the correctness and completeness of transformed data before import.
subtasks.details: Validation should include schema checks, required fields, and logical consistency.

subtasks.title: Set Up Background Import with IPC
subtasks.description: Implement background import functionality using inter-process communication (IPC) for coordination.
subtasks.details: This allows imports to run asynchronously and enables communication between the main application and import workers.

subtasks.title: Cache Parsed Data
subtasks.description: Introduce a caching layer for parsed and transformed data to speed up repeated imports and reduce redundant processing.
subtasks.details: The cache should be invalidated appropriately when source data changes or fails validation.

tasks.title: Implement EVE ESI OAuth 2.0 PKCE Authentication
tasks.description: Setup secure OAuth 2.0 PKCE flow for EVE Online ESI API authentication without requiring a backend server
tasks.details: Implement PKCE flow using electron's protocol.registerHttpProtocol for callback handling. Use crypto.randomBytes(32) for code verifier generation. Create AuthService with methods: generatePKCEChallenge(), initiateLogin(), handleCallback(). Store refresh tokens securely using electron-store@8.1.0 with encryption. Implement token refresh logic with automatic retry. Configure scopes: esi-skills.read_skills.v1, esi-universe.read_structures.v1, esi-markets.read_character_orders.v1. Handle auth errors gracefully with user-friendly messages.
tasks.testStrategy: Test full auth flow, verify PKCE implementation against RFC 7636, test token refresh, verify secure storage, test error scenarios

subtasks.title: Implement PKCE Challenge Generation
subtasks.description: Generate a cryptographically secure code_verifier and derive the code_challenge using a secure hash algorithm (typically SHA256). Ensure the code_challenge_method is set appropriately.
subtasks.details: This step involves creating a random code_verifier and hashing it to produce the code_challenge, which will be used in the authorization request.

subtasks.title: Configure OAuth Scopes
subtasks.description: Define and configure the required OAuth scopes for the application to request appropriate permissions from the user during the authorization process.
subtasks.details: Ensure that the scopes requested align with the application's needs and follow the principle of least privilege.

subtasks.title: Initiate Login Flow
subtasks.description: Start the OAuth authorization request by redirecting the user to the authorization server with the code_challenge, code_challenge_method, and configured scopes.
subtasks.details: This step involves constructing the authorization URL with all necessary parameters and handling the user redirection.

subtasks.title: Securely Store Tokens
subtasks.description: Implement secure storage mechanisms for access, refresh, and ID tokens to prevent unauthorized access or leakage.
subtasks.details: Use platform-appropriate secure storage solutions (e.g., encrypted storage, keychain) to store sensitive tokens.

subtasks.title: Implement Token Refresh Logic
subtasks.description: Use the refresh token to obtain new access tokens when the current access token expires, ensuring continuous authentication.
subtasks.details: Handle token expiration, securely use the refresh token, and update stored tokens as needed.

subtasks.title: Handle Authentication Errors
subtasks.description: Implement robust error handling for all stages of the PKCE flow, including challenge generation, login, callback, token storage, and refresh.
subtasks.details: Detect, log, and respond to errors such as invalid tokens, failed exchanges, or storage issues, providing appropriate user feedback and recovery options.

tasks.title: Build ESI API Integration Layer
tasks.description: Create comprehensive API client for EVE Online ESI endpoints with caching and rate limiting
tasks.details: Create ESIClient class using axios with interceptors for auth token injection. Implement rate limiting using p-limit@5.0.0 (20 requests/second). Add response caching with node-cache@5.1.2 (TTL based on ESI headers). Create typed interfaces for all ESI responses. Implement endpoints: /characters/{id}/skills/, /universe/types/{id}/, /markets/prices/, /markets/{region}/orders/. Add retry logic with exponential backoff using axios-retry@4.0.0. Handle ESI error codes properly. Create request queue for batch operations.
tasks.testStrategy: Mock ESI responses for unit tests, test rate limiting behavior, verify cache invalidation, test error handling and retries

subtasks.title: Create API Client
subtasks.description: Develop a base API client for ESI that will handle HTTP requests and responses
subtasks.details: Implement a client class that will serve as the foundation for all ESI API interactions. Include configuration for base URLs for both live and staging environments, HTTP client setup, and request/response handling infrastructure.

subtasks.title: Add Rate Limiting
subtasks.description: Implement rate limiting to comply with ESI API restrictions
subtasks.details: Create a rate limiting mechanism that tracks request frequency, implements backoff strategies, and queues requests when approaching limits. Include configurable thresholds based on ESI's documented rate limits.

subtasks.title: Implement Response Caching
subtasks.description: Add caching layer to store API responses and reduce unnecessary requests
subtasks.details: Develop a caching system that stores responses based on request parameters with configurable TTL. Implement cache invalidation strategies and ensure proper handling of cache headers from ESI responses.

subtasks.title: Define Typed Interfaces
subtasks.description: Create strongly-typed interfaces for ESI API requests and responses
subtasks.details: Define comprehensive type definitions for all API endpoints, request parameters, and response objects. Ensure proper validation and type checking to improve developer experience and reduce runtime errors.

subtasks.title: Implement Endpoints
subtasks.description: Build specific endpoint implementations using the base client
subtasks.details: Create individual endpoint implementations that leverage the base client. Group related endpoints into logical services or modules. Include parameter validation and response transformation as needed.

subtasks.title: Add Retry Logic
subtasks.description: Implement automatic retry mechanism for failed requests
subtasks.details: Develop a retry system that automatically retries failed requests with exponential backoff. Configure retry policies based on specific error codes and ensure integration with the rate limiting system to prevent excessive retries.

subtasks.title: Handle Error Codes
subtasks.description: Implement comprehensive error handling for ESI API responses
subtasks.details: Create a standardized error handling system that processes ESI error responses, translates them into application-specific exceptions, and provides meaningful error messages. Include logging and monitoring capabilities for troubleshooting.

tasks.title: Design Core Data Models and Types
tasks.description: Create comprehensive TypeScript interfaces and classes for all domain entities
tasks.details: Define interfaces in src/shared/types: IShip (slots: {high, mid, low, rig, subsystem}, attributes, bonuses), IModule (typeID, slot, meta, attributes, requirements), IFitting (ship, modules[], charges[], drones[], implants[]), ICharacterSkills (Map<skillID, level>), IOptimizationResult (fittings[], score, analysis). Create value objects for DamageProfile, ResistanceProfile. Implement domain logic classes: Ship, Fitting, Module with methods for validation. Use zod@3.22.4 for runtime validation. Create factory functions for complex object creation.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test all model validations, test serialization/deserialization, verify type safety with TypeScript strict mode

subtasks.title: Define Interfaces and Type Structures
subtasks.description: Create TypeScript interfaces that clearly define the domain model structure with strict type-checking
subtasks.details: Use TypeScript interfaces to define the domain model structure. Avoid using 'any' type and instead use more specific types or 'unknown' when necessary. Organize related interfaces into modules for better maintainability. Use union types instead of function overloads where appropriate.

subtasks.title: Implement Value Objects
subtasks.description: Create immutable value objects that represent domain concepts with proper validation
subtasks.details: Implement value objects as immutable structures using readonly properties or Object.freeze(). Ensure proper validation in constructors. Use utility types for common patterns. Prefer pure functions and avoid side effects. Consider using factory functions for complex object creation.

subtasks.title: Create Domain Logic Classes
subtasks.description: Develop domain logic classes that implement business rules and operations
subtasks.details: Create classes that encapsulate domain logic and business rules. Follow naming conventions with descriptive names. Keep functions small and focused. Reduce function parameters and use parameter defaults where appropriate. Organize code with proper modularization.

subtasks.title: Add Runtime Validation
subtasks.description: Implement runtime validation to ensure data integrity beyond compile-time type checking
subtasks.details: Add runtime validation to complement TypeScript's compile-time checks. Implement validation logic for user inputs and external data. Use descriptive error messages. Consider using validation libraries if appropriate. Handle edge cases and invalid inputs gracefully.

subtasks.title: Create Factory Functions
subtasks.description: Develop factory functions to standardize object creation with proper validation
subtasks.details: Implement factory functions that encapsulate object creation logic. Ensure proper validation is performed during object creation. Use descriptive names for factory functions. Consider implementing builder patterns for complex object creation scenarios.

subtasks.title: Write Unit Tests for Validation
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive unit tests to verify type constraints and validation logic
subtasks.details: Write unit tests that verify both the type constraints and runtime validation logic. Test edge cases and error conditions. Ensure tests are isolated and repeatable. Use test-driven development approach when appropriate. Verify that factory functions create valid objects.

tasks.title: Create React Application Shell with Material-UI
tasks.description: Setup React application structure with Material-UI components and routing
tasks.details: Install react@18.2.0, react-dom@18.2.0, @mui/material@5.15.3, @emotion/react@11.11.3. Setup React Router v6 with routes: /ships, /fittings, /skills, /market. Create layout components: AppBar with navigation, Drawer for sidebar, Container for main content. Implement Material-UI theme with EVE Online color scheme (dark theme default). Setup responsive breakpoints. Create reusable components: LoadingSpinner, ErrorBoundary, ConfirmDialog. Configure webpack for optimal React builds with code splitting.
tasks.testStrategy: Test component rendering, verify routing works, test responsive behavior, check theme application, test error boundaries

subtasks.title: Install Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install necessary dependencies for the React app, including Material-UI and React Router.
subtasks.details: Use npm or yarn to install required packages.

subtasks.title: Set Up Routing
subtasks.description: Configure React Router for client-side routing.
subtasks.details: Create routes for different pages and components.

subtasks.title: Create Layout Components
subtasks.description: Design and implement basic layout components like Header, Footer, and Sidebar.
subtasks.details: Use Material-UI components for styling.

subtasks.title: Implement Theme
subtasks.description: Apply a consistent theme across the application using Material-UI.
subtasks.details: Define colors, typography, and spacing.

subtasks.title: Configure Responsive Breakpoints
subtasks.description: Set up responsive design using Material-UI's breakpoints.
subtasks.details: Ensure layout adapts to different screen sizes.

subtasks.title: Create Reusable Components
subtasks.description: Develop reusable UI components for common elements like buttons and forms.
subtasks.details: Use Material-UI for styling and consistency.

subtasks.title: Optimize Webpack for React
subtasks.description: Configure Webpack for optimal performance in a React environment.
subtasks.details: Minify code, split chunks, and optimize for production.

tasks.title: Implement State Management with Zustand
tasks.description: Setup global state management using Zustand for application-wide state
tasks.details: Install zustand@4.5.0. Create stores: useAuthStore (user, tokens, login/logout), useShipStore (ships, filters, selectedShip), useFittingStore (fittings, activeFitting, modifications), useSkillStore (characterSkills, skillQueue). Implement persistence for user preferences using zustand/middleware persist with electron-store. Create computed values using zustand subscriptions. Implement store devtools for debugging. Add TypeScript types for all store slices. Create store hooks with proper memoization.
tasks.testStrategy: Test state updates, verify persistence works, test computed values update correctly, verify no unnecessary re-renders

tasks.title: Build Ship Browser UI Component
tasks.description: Create comprehensive ship browsing interface with filtering and skill-aware display
tasks.details: Create ShipBrowser component with Material-UI DataGrid for ship list. Implement filters: race (Caldari, Gallente, etc.), ship class, tech level, skill requirements met. Add search with fuzzy matching using fuse.js@7.0.0. Display ship cards with: image, name, slot layout, base stats, skill requirements (green if met, red if not). Implement virtualization for performance with react-window@1.8.10. Add sorting by name, class, required skills. Create ship detail modal with full stats. Use React.memo for optimization.
tasks.testStrategy: Test filtering logic, verify skill requirement calculations, test performance with 500+ ships, test search functionality

subtasks.title: Implement Filters
subtasks.description: Add filtering functionality to narrow down ship results based on specific criteria.
subtasks.details: Use state management to handle filter changes.

subtasks.title: Add Search with Fuzzy Matching
subtasks.description: Integrate a search bar with fuzzy matching to find ships by name or other attributes.
subtasks.details: Utilize a library like Fuse.js for fuzzy matching.

subtasks.title: Display Ship Cards
subtasks.description: Create and render individual ship cards within the main component.
subtasks.details: Use JSX to define the card structure and content.

subtasks.title: Implement Virtualization
subtasks.description: Optimize performance by implementing virtualization for large datasets of ship cards.
subtasks.details: Use libraries like react-window for efficient rendering.

subtasks.title: Add Sorting
subtasks.description: Allow users to sort ship cards by various attributes.
subtasks.details: Use state to manage sorting order and apply it to the rendered cards.

subtasks.title: Create Detail Modal
subtasks.description: Design and implement a modal to display detailed information about a selected ship.
subtasks.details: Use React Portal for modal rendering.

subtasks.title: Optimize with React.memo
subtasks.description: Use React.memo to memoize components and improve performance by reducing unnecessary re-renders.
subtasks.details: Apply memoization to components that do not change frequently.

tasks.title: Implement Fitting Statistics Calculation Engine
tasks.description: Build comprehensive fitting statistics calculator with all EVE Online mechanics
tasks.details: Create FittingCalculator class implementing: DPS calculation (turrets, missiles, drones), tank calculation (shield/armor/hull HP, resistances, regen), capacitor simulation (peak recharge, stability), speed/agility calculations. Implement stacking penalties using formula: effect * 0.5^((n-1)/2.22292081). Handle skill bonuses application. Calculate CPU/PG usage with skills. Implement damage profiles (Uniform, EM/Thermal, etc.). Create calculation cache with dependency tracking. Handle all module effects (damage mods, tank mods, prop mods). Consider implants and boosters.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit test each calculation against known EVE values, test stacking penalties, verify capacitor simulation accuracy, benchmark performance

subtasks.title: Implement Tank Calculation
subtasks.description: Create algorithms to compute effective hit points (EHP), shield/armor/hull resistances, and repair rates for the fitting.
subtasks.details: Must support stacking penalties, module effects, and skill bonuses affecting tank modules.

subtasks.title: Implement Capacitor Simulation
subtasks.description: Simulate capacitor usage and regeneration over time, including module activation costs, passive recharge, and capacitor boosters.
subtasks.details: Should model capacitor stability and time-to-cap depletion under various module activation scenarios.

subtasks.title: Implement Speed and Agility Calculations
subtasks.description: Calculate maximum velocity, acceleration, align time, and agility based on ship stats, modules, rigs, and skills.
subtasks.details: Must account for stacking penalties and all relevant modifiers.

subtasks.title: Implement Stacking Penalties Logic
subtasks.description: Develop the system to apply stacking penalties to modules and effects as per game mechanics.
subtasks.details: Should be reusable by other calculation modules (tank, speed, etc.) and handle all stacking groups.

subtasks.title: Implement Skill Bonuses Application
subtasks.description: Integrate skill-based bonuses into all relevant calculations (DPS, tank, capacitor, speed, etc.).
subtasks.details: Must support dynamic skill levels and their impact on ship and module performance.

subtasks.title: Implement CPU and Powergrid Usage Calculation
subtasks.description: Calculate total CPU and powergrid (PG) usage for the fitting, including all modules, rigs, and their modifiers.
subtasks.details: Should flag overfitting and support skill/module/rig bonuses to fitting resources.

subtasks.title: Implement Damage Profile Handling
subtasks.description: Support calculation and display of damage profiles (EM, Thermal, Kinetic, Explosive) for both offense and defense.
subtasks.details: Must integrate with DPS and tank calculations to show effective damage and resistances.

subtasks.title: Implement Calculation Cache System
subtasks.description: Design and implement a caching mechanism to store and retrieve calculation results for performance optimization.
subtasks.details: Should invalidate cache on relevant input changes and support partial recalculation.

subtasks.title: Implement Module Effect Handling Engine
subtasks.description: Develop a flexible system to apply module effects (active/passive, local/remote, conditional) to ship stats and calculations.
subtasks.details: Must support stacking penalties, skill interactions, and be extensible for new module types.

subtasks.title: Implement DPS Calculation
subtasks.description: Implement the basic DPS calculation, including placeholders for turrets, missiles, and drones.
subtasks.details: This will involve adding a new `calculateDps` method to the `FittingCalculator` class. The initial implementation will focus on the core damage formula and will include placeholders for applying skill and module effects.

subtasks.title: Enhance EHP Calculation with Module and Skill Effects
subtasks.description: Flesh out the EHP calculation by applying module and skill effects to resistances.
subtasks.details: This will involve adding logic to the `calculateEhp` method to iterate through the fitted modules, identify resistance-modifying effects, and apply them to the base ship resistances before calculating the final EHP. It will also include placeholders for skill effects.

subtasks.title: Enhance Capacitor Calculation
subtasks.description: Enhance the capacitor calculation by applying module and skill effects and calculating total capacitor usage from modules.
subtasks.details: This will involve adding logic to the `calculateCapacitor` method to iterate through the fitted modules, identify capacitor-related effects, and apply them to the ship's base capacitor stats. It will also calculate the total capacitor usage from all active modules.

subtasks.title: Enhance Speed and Agility Calculation
subtasks.description: Enhance the speed and agility calculation by applying module and skill effects.
subtasks.details: This will involve adding logic to the `calculateSpeedAndAgility` method to iterate through the fitted modules, identify speed and agility-related effects, and apply them to the ship's base stats. It will also include placeholders for skill effects.

subtasks.title: Map SDE Attribute IDs for Fitting Calculator
subtasks.description: Replace placeholder attribute IDs in the FittingCalculator with the correct IDs from the SDE.
subtasks.details: This task involves researching the correct attribute IDs for all relevant fitting statistics (resistances, capacitor, speed, etc.) by querying the SDE data in the local database. Once the correct IDs are identified, the FittingCalculator will be updated to use them, removing the placeholder values. This will also involve updating the module effect application logic to use the correct attributes.

tasks.title: Create Fitting Display and Editor UI
tasks.description: Build interactive fitting display with drag-and-drop module management
tasks.details: Create FittingEditor component with ship hull display showing slot layout. Implement drag-and-drop using react-dnd@16.0.1 for modules between slots. Show real-time stats update on module changes. Display fitting stats panel: DPS (by type), EHP, cap stability, speed, signature. Create module browser with categories, search, and skill filtering. Implement right-click context menus for module actions. Add visual indicators for CPU/PG usage (progress bars). Show module tooltips with stats. Create charge/script selection UI.
tasks.testStrategy: Test drag-and-drop in all browsers, verify stat updates are immediate, test module compatibility validation, test UI responsiveness

subtasks.title: Create Main Editor Component
subtasks.description: Develop the core editor interface that will serve as the foundation for the fitting editor UI
subtasks.details: Design and implement the main editor layout with proper containers for modules, stats panel, and other UI elements. Ensure the component has a responsive design and follows UI design patterns for intuitive navigation.

subtasks.title: Implement Drag-and-Drop Functionality
subtasks.description: Add the ability to drag and drop modules within the editor interface
subtasks.details: Implement the Inplace Editor pattern to allow users to manipulate modules directly in the interface. Include visual feedback during drag operations, valid drop zones highlighting, and proper event handling for module placement and rearrangement.

subtasks.title: Build Module Browser Component
subtasks.description: Create a browsable interface for selecting modules to add to the fitting
subtasks.details: Design a categorized module browser with search functionality, filtering options, and preview capabilities. Implement a consistent UI pattern for module selection and ensure smooth integration with the drag-and-drop system.

subtasks.title: Implement Real-Time Stats Calculation
subtasks.description: Create the logic to calculate and update fitting statistics as changes are made
subtasks.details: Develop the backend logic to process module changes and calculate relevant statistics in real-time. Ensure efficient computation to maintain UI responsiveness during updates and changes to the fitting configuration.

subtasks.title: Display Stats Panel
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive panel to display all relevant fitting statistics
subtasks.details: Design and implement a stats panel that clearly presents all relevant fitting information. Include visual indicators for optimal/suboptimal values and organize information in logical categories for easy scanning and comprehension.

subtasks.title: Add Context Menus
subtasks.description: Implement context-sensitive menus for modules and editor components
subtasks.details: Create context menus that provide relevant actions based on the selected element. Ensure menus follow UI design patterns for consistency and include keyboard shortcuts where appropriate. Implement proper positioning and focus management.

subtasks.title: Show CPU/PG Indicators
subtasks.description: Implement visual indicators for CPU and power grid usage
subtasks.details: Design and implement clear visual indicators for CPU and power grid usage that update in real-time. Include appropriate color coding for different usage levels and ensure the indicators are prominently displayed for quick reference.

subtasks.title: Implement Tooltips System
subtasks.description: Create an informative tooltip system for all interactive elements
subtasks.details: Develop a consistent tooltip system that provides helpful information about modules, stats, and UI controls. Ensure tooltips appear with appropriate timing, positioning, and styling. Include detailed information relevant to the context.

subtasks.title: Create Charge/Script Selection UI
subtasks.description: Implement interface for selecting and configuring charges and scripts
subtasks.details: Design and implement UI components for selecting charges and scripts with appropriate configuration options. Include preview functionality and ensure the interface integrates with the overall fitting editor while maintaining consistency with established UI patterns.

tasks.title: Implement Multi-Objective Optimization Algorithm
tasks.description: Build genetic algorithm for generating optimized fittings across DPS-Tank spectrum
tasks.details: Implement NSGA-II algorithm for multi-objective optimization. Create FittingOptimizer class with fitness functions for DPS, EHP, cap stability. Generate initial population using heuristics (weapon systems, tank type). Implement crossover operations respecting slot constraints. Add mutation operators (swap modules, change charges). Use Pareto frontier selection. Configure parameters: population size 100, generations 50, mutation rate 0.1. Implement early stopping on convergence. Add constraints for CPU/PG, skill requirements. Create 5 representative fittings from Pareto frontier.
tasks.testStrategy: Test algorithm convergence, verify Pareto optimality, test constraint satisfaction, benchmark optimization speed

subtasks.title: Implement NSGA-II Core Structure
subtasks.description: Create the main NSGA-II algorithm framework with the basic genetic algorithm structure and modified selection mechanisms
subtasks.details: Implement the core NSGA-II structure following the general outline of genetic algorithms with modified mating and survival selection. Include the non-dominated sorting approach with O(MNÂ²) computational complexity where M is the number of objectives and N is the population size. Create the main loop structure that combines parent and offspring populations.

subtasks.title: Create Multi-Objective Fitness Functions
subtasks.description: Develop fitness functions that can evaluate solutions across multiple objectives
subtasks.details: Design and implement fitness functions that can handle multiple competing objectives. These functions should be able to evaluate solutions based on different criteria and return a vector of fitness values rather than a single scalar value. Test with benchmark problems like ZDT1 or ZDT5.

subtasks.title: Generate Initial Population
subtasks.description: Implement methods to create a diverse initial population of candidate solutions
subtasks.details: Create sampling methods for generating the initial population with appropriate diversity. Implement different sampling strategies like BinaryRandomSampling for binary decision variables or other sampling methods depending on the problem domain. Ensure the population size is configurable.

subtasks.title: Implement Crossover Operators
subtasks.description: Develop crossover mechanisms for creating offspring from parent solutions
subtasks.details: Implement various crossover operators such as TwoPointCrossover for binary problems or other appropriate crossover methods for different problem types. Ensure the crossover probability is configurable and the operators maintain solution validity.

subtasks.title: Add Mutation Operators
subtasks.description: Create mutation functions to introduce diversity in the population
subtasks.details: Implement mutation operators like BitflipMutation for binary problems or other appropriate mutation methods. Ensure mutation rates are configurable and the operators maintain solution validity while introducing sufficient diversity to avoid premature convergence.

subtasks.title: Handle Constraints
subtasks.description: Develop mechanisms to handle constrained optimization problems
subtasks.details: Modify the dominance definition to efficiently solve constrained multi-objective problems. Implement constraint handling techniques that can work with problems having multiple constraints (e.g., the referenced five-objective seven-constraint nonlinear problem).

subtasks.title: Implement Pareto Selection
subtasks.description: Create the non-dominated sorting and crowding distance calculation for Pareto-based selection
subtasks.details: Implement the fast non-dominated sorting approach to rank solutions into different non-dominated fronts. Add crowding distance calculation to maintain diversity along the Pareto front. Create the crowded-comparison operator for tournament selection and final population selection.

subtasks.title: Configure Algorithm Parameters
subtasks.description: Create a parameter configuration system for the NSGA-II algorithm
subtasks.details: Develop a configuration system that allows setting all relevant parameters: population size, number of generations, crossover and mutation probabilities, selection pressure, and other algorithm-specific parameters. Include options for eliminating duplicates.

subtasks.title: Add Early Stopping Criteria
subtasks.description: Implement various termination conditions beyond maximum iterations
subtasks.details: Add multiple stopping criteria beyond the typical maximum number of iterations, such as convergence measures, diversity thresholds, or computational budget limits. Implement a flexible framework that allows combining different stopping criteria.

subtasks.title: Generate Representative Fittings
subtasks.description: Create visualization and analysis tools for the Pareto-optimal solutions
subtasks.details: Implement visualization tools like Scatter plots to display the Pareto front. Add functionality to compare the obtained front with the true Pareto front when available. Create methods to analyze the spread and convergence of solutions and to help decision-makers select final solutions from the Pareto set.

tasks.title: Build Optimization Results Display
tasks.description: Create UI for displaying and comparing optimization results
tasks.details: Create OptimizationResults component showing 5 generated fittings. Display fittings on DPS vs Tank scatter plot using recharts@2.10.4. Implement fitting comparison table with key stats. Add radar chart for multi-dimensional comparison (DPS, tank, speed, cap). Create fitting cards with preview and quick stats. Implement 'Apply Fitting' button to load into editor. Add export options (EFT, in-game format). Show optimization parameters used. Create animation for optimization progress. Add tooltips explaining each fitting's strengths.
tasks.testStrategy: Test chart rendering with various data ranges, verify comparison accuracy, test export formats, check responsive design

subtasks.title: Create Results Component
subtasks.description: Develop the main results display component that will serve as the container for all visualization and interaction elements.
subtasks.details: This component will manage the layout and integration of all subcomponents, ensuring a cohesive user experience and consistent styling across the dashboard.

subtasks.title: Implement Scatter Plot
subtasks.description: Add a scatter plot visualization to display data distributions and relationships.
subtasks.details: Integrate a scatter plot chart within the results component, ensuring it supports interactive features such as tooltips and zooming.

subtasks.title: Build Comparison Table
subtasks.description: Create a table for side-by-side comparison of key metrics and results.
subtasks.details: Design and implement a comparison table that allows users to easily compare different data sets or optimization runs.

subtasks.title: Add Radar Chart
subtasks.description: Integrate a radar chart to visualize multi-dimensional performance metrics.
subtasks.details: The radar chart should be interactive and visually consistent with other dashboard elements, supporting comparison across multiple axes.

subtasks.title: Create Fitting Cards
subtasks.description: Design and implement card components to display individual fitting results or model summaries.
subtasks.details: Each card should encapsulate key information, such as model parameters, scores, and visualizations, following a consistent layout for easy scanning.

subtasks.title: Implement Apply Button
subtasks.description: Add an 'Apply' button to trigger actions such as applying selected filters or optimization settings.
subtasks.details: Ensure the button is clearly visible and provides feedback upon interaction, updating the results display as needed.

subtasks.title: Add Export Options
subtasks.description: Enable users to export results and visualizations in various formats (e.g., CSV, PNG, PDF).
subtasks.details: Provide export functionality for tables, charts, and overall results, ensuring compatibility with common data formats.

subtasks.title: Show Optimization Parameters
subtasks.description: Display the optimization parameters used for generating the results, ensuring transparency and reproducibility.
subtasks.details: Present the parameters in a clear, accessible format, possibly within a dedicated section or modal within the results component.

tasks.title: Implement Fitting Import/Export System
tasks.description: Build comprehensive fitting format parser and exporter supporting multiple formats
tasks.details: Create FittingParser class supporting formats: EFT (EVE Fitting Tool), XML (in-game), PYFA. Implement regex-based EFT parser handling all edge cases. Create XML parser using fast-xml-parser@4.3.3. Build format detection from clipboard/file content. Implement exporters for each format with proper formatting. Handle cargo, drones, charges in all formats. Create clipboard integration using Electron clipboard API. Add batch import capability. Implement format validation with helpful error messages. Support URL-based fitting links.
tasks.testStrategy: Test parsing of complex fittings in all formats, verify round-trip import/export, test error handling for malformed inputs

subtasks.title: Implement EFT Parser
subtasks.description: Develop a parser for Electronic File Transfer (EFT) format that can accurately read and interpret EFT data structures.
subtasks.details: Create a robust parser that handles EFT format specifications, including header validation, record parsing, and error handling for malformed EFT files. Ensure compatibility with industry-standard EFT formats and implement proper exception handling for corrupted files.

subtasks.title: Create XML Parser
subtasks.description: Build a comprehensive XML parser to import and export data in XML format.
subtasks.details: Develop an XML parser that can read XML definition files, validate against schemas, and properly handle namespaces. Implement DOM or SAX parsing depending on file sizes, and ensure proper entity handling and character encoding support.

subtasks.title: Build Format Detection System
subtasks.description: Create an intelligent system that can automatically detect and identify file formats for processing.
subtasks.details: Implement format detection algorithms that analyze file headers, content patterns, and extensions to automatically determine the appropriate parser to use. Support detection of EFT, XML, CSV, and other common formats without requiring user specification.

subtasks.title: Implement Data Exporters
subtasks.description: Develop export functionality for all supported formats to enable data extraction.
subtasks.details: Create export modules that can transform internal data structures into EFT, XML, CSV and other formats. Implement configurable export parameters, field mapping capabilities, and support for partial exports of selected data subsets.

subtasks.title: Handle Specialized Data Types
subtasks.description: Extend the import/export system to properly handle cargo, drones, and charges data types.
subtasks.details: Implement specialized parsers and formatters for cargo manifests, drone specifications, and financial charges data. Create data validation rules specific to each type and ensure proper relationship mapping between these specialized entities.

subtasks.title: Add Clipboard Integration
subtasks.description: Implement clipboard functionality to allow copy/paste operations with the import/export system.
subtasks.details: Develop clipboard handlers that can detect and process formatted data from the clipboard. Support copying exported data to clipboard in various formats and pasting data directly into the application for quick imports without requiring file operations.

subtasks.title: Implement Batch Import Processing
subtasks.description: Create a system for handling multiple file imports as a single batch operation.
subtasks.details: Build a batch processing framework that can queue multiple import files, process them sequentially or in parallel, maintain transaction integrity across files, and provide consolidated reporting on batch results. Implement recovery mechanisms for partial batch failures.

subtasks.title: Add Format Validation Framework
subtasks.description: Develop a comprehensive validation system to verify data integrity and format compliance.
subtasks.details: Create a validation framework with configurable rules for different data formats and types. Implement multi-level validation including syntax checking, semantic validation, business rule validation, and relationship verification. Provide detailed validation reports and error correction suggestions.

tasks.title: Create Character Skills Management Interface
tasks.description: Build comprehensive skill viewer and planner interface
tasks.details: Create SkillsView component displaying character skills in categories. Show skill levels with progress bars. Implement skill search and filtering. Display total SP and unallocated SP. Create skill queue viewer showing training plan. Add 'Skills for Fitting' analyzer showing missing skills. Implement skill plan optimizer suggesting shortest path to fly a ship/fitting. Use Material-UI TreeView for skill categories. Add skill tooltips with descriptions and bonuses. Create visual skill requirement trees. Cache skill data with 1-hour TTL.
tasks.testStrategy: Test skill calculations, verify queue time estimates, test skill requirement analysis, check data synchronization with ESI

subtasks.title: Create Skills View Component
subtasks.description: Design and implement the main skills view component that will serve as the container for all skill-related information and interactions.
subtasks.details: Build a reusable component that displays skills in an organized layout. Implement proper visual hierarchy to highlight important skill information. Follow component architecture best practices by keeping the component focused on a single task and ensuring it can accept props for dynamic data display.

subtasks.title: Implement Search and Filtering Functionality
subtasks.description: Create search and filtering components that allow users to quickly find specific skills or filter skills based on various criteria.
subtasks.details: Design input fields for search functionality with real-time results. Implement dropdown menus or checkboxes for filtering options. Ensure the components are responsive and provide clear visual feedback during user interaction. Consider implementing debounce for search to optimize performance.

subtasks.title: Display SP and Queue Information
subtasks.description: Create components to display Skill Points (SP) and queue information in an intuitive and user-friendly manner.
subtasks.details: Design progress bars or numerical indicators for SP display. Implement a queue visualization that shows pending skill acquisitions. Ensure these components update dynamically when changes occur. Use appropriate color theory to indicate different states or priorities in the queue.

subtasks.title: Build Skill Analyzer Component
subtasks.description: Develop a component that analyzes skills and provides useful insights or recommendations to the user.
subtasks.details: Create an analyzer that processes skill data and generates meaningful metrics. Implement data visualization elements like charts or graphs to represent analysis results. Ensure the component can handle complex calculations while maintaining good performance. Design clear visual outputs that help users understand the analysis.

subtasks.title: Implement Skill Optimizer
subtasks.description: Create a component that helps users optimize their skill selections based on various factors and goals.
subtasks.details: Design an interface that allows users to set optimization goals. Implement algorithms that calculate optimal skill paths based on user inputs. Create visual representations of optimization results using appropriate UI elements like tables or highlighted paths. Ensure the optimizer provides clear explanations of its recommendations.

subtasks.title: Add Tooltips for Skill Information
subtasks.description: Implement tooltips that provide additional information about skills when users hover over or interact with skill elements.
subtasks.details: Design tooltips that display relevant skill details without cluttering the interface. Implement hover or click interactions to trigger tooltips. Ensure tooltips are positioned correctly and don't obscure important content. Include helpful information in tooltips such as skill requirements, benefits, and relationships to other skills.

subtasks.title: Create Skill Trees Visualization
subtasks.description: Develop a component that visualizes skill relationships and dependencies in a tree or graph structure.
subtasks.details: Design an interactive skill tree that clearly shows relationships between skills. Implement navigation controls for large skill trees. Ensure the visualization is responsive and works across different screen sizes. Add visual indicators for acquired skills, available skills, and locked skills within the tree structure.

subtasks.title: Implement Skill Data Caching
subtasks.description: Create a caching mechanism to improve performance when loading and displaying skill data.
subtasks.details: Implement client-side caching of skill data to reduce server requests. Design a cache invalidation strategy to ensure data freshness. Create loading states for when cache is being populated. Optimize the caching mechanism to prioritize frequently accessed skill information for better user experience.

tasks.title: Implement Activity-Specific Fitting Templates
tasks.description: Create system for activity-based fitting recommendations and constraints
tasks.details: Define activity profiles: PvP (solo, fleet), PvE (missions L1-L4, abyssal), Mining, Exploration. Create constraint sets per activity (e.g., PvP needs tackle, PvE needs tank). Implement template system with required/recommended modules. Create ActivityOptimizer extending base optimizer with activity constraints. Add activity selection UI in optimization flow. Store common fits per activity as starting points. Implement activity-specific fitness functions. Create explanation system for activity choices. Add custom activity definition capability.
tasks.testStrategy: Test constraint application for each activity, verify optimization produces viable fits, test template system, validate recommendations

subtasks.title: Define Activity Profiles
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive data structure for activity profiles that captures all necessary attributes and parameters for different types of activities.
subtasks.details: Design a flexible schema that can represent various activity types with their specific characteristics, constraints, and requirements. Include metadata fields for categorization and searchability.

subtasks.title: Create Constraint Sets
subtasks.description: Develop a system to define and manage sets of constraints that can be applied to different activity types.
subtasks.details: Implement a constraint definition language that allows for complex rule creation. Include validation mechanisms to ensure constraint consistency and compatibility between different constraint sets.

subtasks.title: Implement Template System
subtasks.description: Build a flexible template system that can generate activity instances based on profiles and constraints.
subtasks.details: Create a template engine that can interpret activity profiles and apply appropriate constraints to generate valid activity instances. Include versioning support for templates and a mechanism for template inheritance.

subtasks.title: Extend Optimizer
subtasks.description: Enhance the existing optimizer to work with the new template system and constraint sets.
subtasks.details: Modify the optimization algorithm to efficiently handle the new constraint types and template structures. Implement a greedy algorithm approach for activity selection to maximize the number of activities that can be performed within given constraints.

subtasks.title: Add Activity Selection UI
subtasks.description: Design and implement a user interface for activity selection and configuration.
subtasks.details: Create an intuitive UI that allows users to browse, filter, and select activities. Include features for indicating and highlighting selected elements, and provide options for simulating interactions with the selected activities.

subtasks.title: Store Common Fits
subtasks.description: Develop a storage system for saving and retrieving commonly used activity configurations.
subtasks.details: Implement a database schema to efficiently store activity configurations and their associated metadata. Include functionality for searching, filtering, and recommending configurations based on user history and preferences.

subtasks.title: Implement Fitness Functions
subtasks.description: Create a set of fitness functions to evaluate the suitability of activities for specific contexts.
subtasks.details: Design and implement various fitness metrics that can assess how well an activity matches given requirements or constraints. Include customizable weighting systems to prioritize different aspects of fitness based on context.

subtasks.title: Create Explanation System
subtasks.description: Develop a system to generate explanations for activity selection decisions.
subtasks.details: Implement a mechanism that can trace the decision-making process of the optimizer and generate human-readable explanations. Include visualizations to help users understand why certain activities were selected or rejected based on constraints and fitness scores.

tasks.title: Build Educational Guidance System
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive educational features explaining fitting decisions
tasks.details: Create FittingExplainer class generating natural language explanations. Implement explanation templates for module choices, trade-offs, synergies. Add 'Why this module?' tooltips with reasoning. Create fitting analysis showing strengths/weaknesses. Implement concept explanations (stacking penalties, resist profiles, etc.). Add interactive tutorials for fitting basics. Create glossary system for EVE terms. Implement 'Learn More' links to EVE University wiki. Add beginner mode with extra guidance. Store explanation templates in JSON for easy updates.
tasks.testStrategy: Test explanation generation accuracy, verify educational content correctness, test tutorial flow, gather user feedback on clarity

subtasks.title: Implement explanation generator
subtasks.description: Develop a system that dynamically generates explanations for educational concepts based on user context and learning level
subtasks.details: Create an AI-powered explanation engine that can break down complex topics into understandable components. The system should follow implementation science principles by identifying the 'active ingredients' of effective explanations and ensuring adaptability to different learning contexts.

subtasks.title: Create templates
subtasks.description: Design standardized templates for different types of educational content to ensure consistency and quality
subtasks.details: Develop a library of templates for various educational content types (lessons, quizzes, examples, etc.) that incorporate evidence-based practices. Templates should be performance-based and focused on measurable outcomes as part of a successful educational system implementation.

subtasks.title: Add tooltips
subtasks.description: Implement contextual help tooltips throughout the application to provide just-in-time assistance
subtasks.details: Create a system of tooltips that appear when users hover over complex terms or concepts. This implementation should consider the 'who' (different user types) and 'what' (specific information needed) to ensure tooltips are helpful without being intrusive.

subtasks.title: Build fitting analysis
subtasks.description: Develop an algorithm to analyze how well educational content matches user needs and learning styles
subtasks.details: Create an analytical system that evaluates the fit between educational content and user requirements. This should incorporate implementation science principles of adaptability and assessment to ensure content can be tailored to meet local needs and individual learning styles.

subtasks.title: Implement concept explanations
subtasks.description: Create in-depth explanations for core educational concepts that can be accessed throughout the application
subtasks.details: Develop comprehensive explanations for fundamental concepts that form the backbone of the educational content. These should be structured according to implementation phases with clear outcomes and success measures for learner understanding.

subtasks.title: Create tutorials
subtasks.description: Design interactive tutorials that guide users through key features and educational processes
subtasks.details: Build step-by-step tutorials that demonstrate how to use the system effectively. Implementation should consider the multilevel nature of educational systems, addressing the needs of different stakeholders and ensuring appropriate communication methods for each group.

subtasks.title: Build glossary
subtasks.description: Compile a comprehensive glossary of educational terms with clear, accessible definitions
subtasks.details: Create an extensive glossary that defines all specialized terminology used in the educational content. This implementation should focus on acceptability and feasibility, ensuring definitions are accurate while remaining accessible to users at different knowledge levels.

subtasks.title: Add beginner mode
subtasks.description: Implement a simplified interface and content presentation for new or novice users
subtasks.details: Develop a specialized mode that presents educational content in a more accessible way for beginners. This implementation should address the 'why' (solving the challenge of intimidating complexity) and include clear phases with short-term, mid-term, and long-term outcomes to measure success.

tasks.title: Implement Market Price Integration
tasks.description: Build real-time market data integration for fitting cost analysis
tasks.details: Extend ESI client for market endpoints (/markets/prices/, /markets/10000002/orders/). Create MarketService with price caching (5-minute TTL). Implement regional market selection (Jita, Amarr, etc.). Calculate total fitting cost including hull, modules, charges, drones. Add price history charts using recharts. Create budget-based fitting constraints for optimizer. Implement price alerts for saved fittings. Add 'Find Cheapest' option for modules. Show price breakdown in fitting display. Cache market data in SQLite for offline access.
tasks.testStrategy: Test price calculation accuracy, verify cache invalidation, test regional price differences, mock ESI market endpoints

subtasks.title: Extend ESI Client for Market Integration
subtasks.description: Enhance the existing ESI client to support new market-related API endpoints and data structures required for market integration.
subtasks.details: Update the ESI client library to fetch market data, handle authentication, and parse new responses as needed for downstream services.

subtasks.title: Implement MarketService
subtasks.description: Develop a MarketService component to encapsulate business logic for market data retrieval, processing, and interaction with the ESI client.
subtasks.details: Create a service layer that interfaces with the extended ESI client, providing methods for querying prices, volumes, and other market metrics.

subtasks.title: Add Regional Selection Functionality
subtasks.description: Enable users to select different market regions, ensuring that all market queries and data visualizations are region-aware.
subtasks.details: Implement UI controls and backend support for region selection, updating queries and data displays based on the selected region.

subtasks.title: Calculate Fitting Cost
subtasks.description: Develop logic to compute the total cost of a ship fitting based on current market prices for all required items in the selected region.
subtasks.details: Aggregate item prices from the MarketService and sum them according to the fitting blueprint, updating dynamically as prices or regions change.

subtasks.title: Build Price Charts
subtasks.description: Implement data visualization components to display historical and current price trends for selected items.
subtasks.details: Use charting libraries to render price history and volatility, sourcing data from the MarketService and updating in real time.

subtasks.title: Implement Budget Constraints
subtasks.description: Add functionality to allow users to set budget limits and receive feedback or warnings if their fitting exceeds the specified budget.
subtasks.details: Integrate budget checks into the fitting cost calculation workflow, providing UI feedback and enforcing constraints as needed.

subtasks.title: Cache Market Data
subtasks.description: Introduce caching mechanisms to store frequently accessed market data, reducing API calls and improving performance.
subtasks.details: Implement in-memory or persistent caching strategies for market queries, with cache invalidation policies based on data freshness requirements.

tasks.title: Create Advanced Fitting Management System
tasks.description: Build comprehensive fitting organization and sharing features
tasks.details: Implement fitting folders/tags system for organization. Create fitting versioning with change history. Add fitting notes and descriptions. Implement fitting search across name, ship, modules. Create fitting comparison tool for side-by-side analysis. Add fitting sharing via URLs (using base64 encoding). Implement fitting templates/favorites system. Create bulk operations (delete, export, move). Add fitting statistics (usage count, last modified). Store fittings in SQLite with full-text search. Implement auto-save with undo/redo.
tasks.testStrategy: Test CRUD operations, verify search functionality, test sharing URLs, validate versioning system, test bulk operations

subtasks.title: Implement Folders and Tags System
subtasks.description: Create a hierarchical folder structure and tagging system to organize fittings
subtasks.details: Design and implement a flexible organization system that allows users to create nested folders and apply multiple tags to fittings. Include drag-and-drop functionality for easy reorganization and bulk tag application.

subtasks.title: Create Versioning System
subtasks.description: Develop a robust versioning mechanism to track changes to fittings over time
subtasks.details: Implement automatic version creation when changes are made, with options to view version history, compare versions, and restore previous versions. Include metadata tracking for each version including timestamp and user information.

subtasks.title: Add Notes and Descriptions Functionality
subtasks.description: Enable users to add detailed notes and descriptions to fittings
subtasks.details: Create rich text editing capabilities for adding formatted notes and descriptions to fittings. Include support for attachments, links, and the ability to tag other users in notes for collaboration.

subtasks.title: Build Search Functionality
subtasks.description: Implement comprehensive search capabilities across all fitting data
subtasks.details: Develop advanced search functionality with filters for folders, tags, content, dates, and other metadata. Include saved searches, recent searches, and search suggestions to enhance user experience.

subtasks.title: Create Comparison Tool
subtasks.description: Develop a tool to compare different fittings or versions side by side
subtasks.details: Build a visual comparison interface that highlights differences between fittings or versions. Include options to compare specific attributes and generate comparison reports.

subtasks.title: Implement Sharing and Collaboration Features
subtasks.description: Enable secure sharing of fittings with different permission levels
subtasks.details: Create a permission system with view, edit, and admin access levels. Implement sharing via links, email invitations, and team/group assignments with audit logs for all sharing activities.

subtasks.title: Add Templates and Favorites System
subtasks.description: Create functionality for saving templates and marking favorites
subtasks.details: Develop a system for creating and applying templates to new fittings. Implement a favorites mechanism for quick access to frequently used fittings with customizable sorting options.

subtasks.title: Build Bulk Operations Functionality
subtasks.description: Implement tools for performing actions on multiple fittings simultaneously
subtasks.details: Create interfaces and backend processes for bulk selection, editing, tagging, moving, sharing, and exporting of fittings. Include progress tracking for large operations and undo functionality.

subtasks.title: Implement Auto-Save and Recovery
subtasks.description: Develop automatic saving and recovery mechanisms
subtasks.details: Create a system that automatically saves changes at regular intervals and during user actions. Implement a recovery system for unsaved changes in case of browser crashes or connectivity issues.

tasks.title: Implement Performance Monitoring and Analytics
tasks.description: Add application performance monitoring and usage analytics
tasks.details: Implement performance monitoring using Electron's performance API. Track app metrics: startup time, memory usage, calculation speeds. Add anonymous usage analytics with opt-in (using Plausible or similar privacy-focused solution). Monitor API response times and cache hit rates. Create performance dashboard in dev mode. Implement error tracking with Sentry (sanitize sensitive data). Add A/B testing framework for UI experiments. Create user feedback system. Log optimization algorithm performance. Generate performance reports.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify metrics accuracy, test privacy compliance, ensure no PII in analytics, test error reporting, benchmark baseline performance

subtasks.title: Implement Metrics Tracking
subtasks.description: Set up infrastructure to collect and store key performance metrics.
subtasks.details: Define relevant metrics, integrate data collection tools, and ensure data is stored securely.

subtasks.title: Add Analytics
subtasks.description: Integrate analytics tools to process and interpret collected metrics.
subtasks.details: Configure analytics platforms, set up data pipelines, and ensure privacy compliance.

subtasks.title: Monitor API Response Times
subtasks.description: Implement monitoring for API endpoints to track response times.
subtasks.details: Instrument APIs, collect response time data, and set up alerts for anomalies.

subtasks.title: Create Dashboard
subtasks.description: Develop a dashboard to visualize performance metrics and analytics.
subtasks.details: Design dashboard layout, integrate data sources, and ensure real-time updates.

subtasks.title: Implement Error Tracking
subtasks.description: Set up error tracking to monitor and log system errors.
subtasks.details: Integrate error logging tools, configure alerts, and ensure error data is accessible.

subtasks.title: Add A/B Testing
subtasks.description: Integrate A/B testing capabilities to compare performance of different features.
subtasks.details: Set up A/B testing framework, define experiments, and ensure privacy compliance.

subtasks.title: Create Feedback System
subtasks.description: Develop a system to collect and analyze user feedback.
subtasks.details: Design feedback collection mechanisms, integrate with analytics, and ensure user privacy.

tasks.title: Build Intelligent Caching System
tasks.description: Implement sophisticated multi-layer caching for optimal performance
tasks.details: Create CacheManager with memory (LRU) and disk (SQLite) layers. Implement cache key generation with versioning. Add TTL management based on data type (SDE: permanent, skills: 1 hour, market: 5 min). Create cache warming on app start for common data. Implement cache invalidation strategies. Add offline mode detection with graceful degradation. Create cache size management with eviction policies. Implement differential updates for large datasets. Add cache statistics monitoring. Use IPC for cache synchronization between processes.
tasks.testStrategy: Test cache hit/miss rates, verify TTL expiration, test offline functionality, measure performance improvements, test cache size limits

subtasks.title: Design and Implement CacheManager
subtasks.description: Develop the core CacheManager component responsible for orchestrating cache operations, including storing, retrieving, and managing cached data.
subtasks.details: Define interfaces and core logic for cache access, ensuring extensibility for future layers and features.

subtasks.title: Integrate Memory and Disk Cache Layers
subtasks.description: Add support for both in-memory and disk-based cache layers to enable multi-tiered caching.
subtasks.details: Implement logic for reading from and writing to both memory and disk, with fallback mechanisms and synchronization between layers.

subtasks.title: Implement Time-To-Live (TTL) Management
subtasks.description: Add TTL support to automatically expire cache entries after a specified duration.
subtasks.details: Ensure each cache entry can be assigned a TTL and that expired entries are purged or refreshed as needed.

subtasks.title: Develop Cache Warming Mechanism
subtasks.description: Create a system to pre-populate the cache with frequently accessed or critical data at startup or on demand.
subtasks.details: Design strategies for identifying and loading hot data to minimize cold start latency.

subtasks.title: Implement Cache Invalidation Strategies
subtasks.description: Develop mechanisms to invalidate or update cache entries when underlying data changes.
subtasks.details: Support manual, event-driven, and TTL-based invalidation to ensure cache consistency.

subtasks.title: Add Offline Detection and Handling
subtasks.description: Enable the cache system to detect offline scenarios and adjust cache behavior accordingly.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to serve stale data or queue updates when the system is offline, resynchronizing when connectivity is restored.

subtasks.title: Implement Cache Size Management and Eviction Policies
subtasks.description: Add mechanisms to monitor and control cache size, including eviction policies like LRU or LFU.
subtasks.details: Ensure optimal resource usage by automatically removing least valuable entries when limits are reached.

subtasks.title: Enable Differential Cache Updates
subtasks.description: Implement support for updating only changed portions of cached data rather than full replacements.
subtasks.details: Optimize network and storage usage by applying diffs or patches to cached entries.

subtasks.title: Add Cache Statistics and Monitoring
subtasks.description: Integrate monitoring tools to track cache performance, hit/miss rates, and resource usage.
subtasks.details: Expose metrics for observability and tuning, supporting alerts and dashboards as needed.

tasks.title: Implement Advanced Skill Planning Optimizer
tasks.description: Build intelligent skill training plan generator for optimal fitting paths
tasks.details: Create SkillPlanOptimizer using graph algorithms for shortest training paths. Calculate skill training times with attribute modifiers. Implement multi-goal optimization (fly multiple ships/fittings). Add skill priority weighting system. Create visual skill plan timeline using Gantt charts. Implement 'remap optimizer' for attribute optimization. Add skill plan comparison tool. Export to EVEMon format. Calculate plan with/without implants. Show intermediate milestone ships. Implement skill book cost calculation. Add Alpha/Omega clone considerations.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify training time calculations, test path optimization, validate against EVE skill planner, test export formats

subtasks.title: Implement Core Skill Optimizer
subtasks.description: Develop the foundational optimization engine that identifies essential competencies and maps current workforce skills against requirements
subtasks.details: Create algorithms to define core competencies, assess current workforce skills, and identify gaps. Implement functionality to forecast future skill needs based on organizational objectives and industry trends. Include methods for prioritizing skill development based on business impact.

subtasks.title: Calculate Training Times
subtasks.description: Build a module to estimate time required for skill acquisition and development
subtasks.details: Develop algorithms to calculate realistic training timelines based on skill complexity, employee learning curves, and available learning resources. Include functionality to adjust estimates based on historical training data and individual employee performance metrics.

subtasks.title: Add Multi-Goal Optimization
subtasks.description: Enhance the optimizer to balance multiple competing objectives simultaneously
subtasks.details: Implement advanced algorithms to handle multiple optimization goals such as minimizing training costs, maximizing skill coverage, and optimizing workforce utilization. Create weighting mechanisms to balance short-term operational needs with long-term strategic skill development.

subtasks.title: Implement Priority Weighting
subtasks.description: Create a system for assigning different weights to skills based on organizational priorities
subtasks.details: Develop a flexible weighting system that allows organizations to prioritize skills based on business impact, strategic importance, and market demand. Include functionality to adjust weights dynamically based on changing business conditions and emerging skill requirements.

subtasks.title: Create Timeline Visualization
subtasks.description: Design and implement visual representations of skill development timelines
subtasks.details: Build interactive visualizations showing skill acquisition paths, training milestones, and projected competency levels over time. Include features to highlight critical skill gaps, training bottlenecks, and optimization opportunities. Ensure visualizations are accessible and intuitive for different stakeholders.

subtasks.title: Add Remap Optimizer
subtasks.description: Develop functionality to reassign and redistribute skills across the workforce
subtasks.details: Create algorithms to optimize the distribution of skills across teams and departments. Implement functionality to identify opportunities for cross-training, skill sharing, and resource reallocation. Include mechanisms to balance workload and ensure critical skill coverage.

subtasks.title: Build Comparison Tool
subtasks.description: Create functionality to compare different skill development scenarios and strategies
subtasks.details: Develop tools to generate and compare multiple skill development scenarios based on different assumptions, constraints, and optimization goals. Include metrics for evaluating scenarios based on cost, time, risk, and strategic alignment. Provide clear visualizations of trade-offs between different approaches.

subtasks.title: Implement Export Functionality
subtasks.description: Create mechanisms to export optimization results in various formats
subtasks.details: Develop export capabilities for skill matrices, development plans, and optimization reports in multiple formats (CSV, PDF, interactive dashboards). Ensure exports include appropriate metadata, timestamps, and version information. Create templates for different stakeholder needs (executives, managers, L&D teams).

subtasks.title: Handle Clone Considerations
subtasks.description: Implement functionality to manage duplicate skills and create skill hierarchies
subtasks.details: Develop mechanisms to identify and manage duplicate or overlapping skills. Create functionality to establish skill hierarchies, prerequisites, and dependencies. Implement tools to consolidate similar skills and standardize skill definitions across the organization.

tasks.title: Create Comprehensive Testing Suite
tasks.description: Build full testing infrastructure for unit, integration, and E2E tests
tasks.details: Setup Jest for unit tests with ts-jest@29.1.1. Configure React Testing Library for component tests. Implement Playwright@1.41.0 for E2E tests. Create test data factories using Fishery. Mock ESI API responses with MSW@2.1.0. Achieve 80% code coverage minimum. Setup GitHub Actions for CI/CD. Create performance benchmarks with Jest. Add visual regression tests with Percy. Implement database tests with in-memory SQLite. Create fitting calculation test suite against known values. Add security tests for auth flow.
tasks.testStrategy: Run tests in CI pipeline, monitor coverage trends, test on Windows/Mac/Linux, run E2E tests nightly, benchmark performance

subtasks.title: Set Up Jest
subtasks.description: Install and configure Jest as the primary test runner for the project.
subtasks.details: Install Jest via npm or yarn, create a basic jest.config.js file, and ensure it is recognized by the project.

subtasks.title: Configure React Testing Library
